clients.name: Fine Arts Museum of San Francisco
Museum of the City of New York

projects.title: City of Memory
projects.description:
Local Projects, in collaboration with CityLore, is developing City of Memory, a map-based interface to an archive of stories about New York City. City of Memory is scheduled to launch in late 2006.

I created the dynamic mapping backend using a combination of open-source geospatial software and public-domain data, as well as more traditional cartographic illustration software.

projects.title: Timescapes
projects.subtitle: A Multimedia Portrait of New York
projects.description:
On view permanently at the Museum of the City of New York, Timescapes is a film telling the history of New York City through maps.

This image is a false-color rendering of New York City and environs, suggesting the terrain and vegetation of the region before urbanization.

projects.title: The Société Anonyme
projects.subtitle: Modernism for America
projects.description: A map illustration intended to convey a sense of the travels and international connections of the artists of the Société Anonyme.

projects.title: Irving Galleries Wall Maps
projects.description: New maps for the walls of the Florence and Herbert Irving Galleries for the Arts of South and Southeast Asia.

projects.title: 2004 Pro-Choice Electoral Map
projects.description: An interactive electoral map allowing users to track election results for pro-choice contenders in Senate, House and governor's races.

projects.title: Up a Creek
projects.description:
Map illustration to accompany an article about an expedition down the Saganavirktok River in Alaska, mounted by a science writer and several climate experts, to observe the effects of global climate change.

I created these pieces by taking imagery for the region from several Landsat 7 wavelength bands, merging them to create a synthetic true-color image, and then draping the resulting composites over a three-dimensional USGS DEM terrain model.

projects.title: Chinese Sculpture
projects.description: More maps of China in the monumental series from Yale UP.

projects.title: Bayou Bend Gardens
projects.description: A plan of the grounds of Bayou Bend, formerly the estate of Ima Hogg, now a museum of American decorative arts.

projects.title: Building the New Majority
projects.description: A cartogram for the 2004 US presidential election dramatizing the concentration of "blue voters" in metropolitan areas rather than in the blue states as such.

projects.title: What Is It?
projects.description: A wall-size map leading viewers into an introductory exhibition of Himalayan Art

projects.title: Raqqa
projects.description: A map of Islamic lands during the medieval period.

projects.title: The Year One
projects.subtitle: Art of the Ancient World East and West
projects.description: A series of four duotone maps, each introducing a major area of the world for a millenial exhibition of art from around the world in the year 1 CE.

projects.title: Between Two Cultures
projects.subtitle: Chinese Paintings from the Robert H. Ellsworth Collection
projects.description: A simple map of China, used as an endpaper design.

projects.title: Monks & Merchants
projects.subtitle: Silk Road Treasures from Northwest China

projects.title: Metropolitan Museum Journal
projects.description: An illustration for volume 36 of the Journal, which is the scholarly periodical published by the Met.

projects.title: Paper Before Print
projects.subtitle: The History and Impact of Paper in the Islamic World
projects.description: Illustrations for a book about the spread of papermaking in the Islamic world.

projects.title: The Collection in Context
projects.subtitle: AsiaSocietyMuseum.org
projects.description: The Asia Society needed over 100 maps to go on their newly redesigned website. I designed a series of basemaps, using their existing design palette, upon which all the other maps were based.

projects.title: Splendid Isolation
projects.subtitle: Art of Easter Island
projects.description: An extremely small-scale map of Easter Island. Shaded relief created by digitizing existing topographic maps and creating and rendering a 3-D terrain model.

projects.title: Tapestry in the Renaissance
projects.subtitle: Art and Magnificence
projects.description: Small map showing sites of tapestry production in the Netherlands.

projects.title: The Berkshires
projects.description: A simple locator map of Berkshire County, Massachusetts for a book of photography showcasing the natural and architectural beauty of that region.

projects.title: Chinese Architecture
projects.description: Part of the monumental Culture and Civilization of China series.

projects.title: Genesis
projects.subtitle: Ideas of Origin in African Sculpture

projects.title: The Legacy of Genghis Khan
projects.subtitle: Courtly Art and Culture in Western Asia, 1256-1353

projects.title: The Chinese Collection
projects.subtitle: Selected Works from the Norton Museum of Art
projects.description: An overall monochrome map of China.

projects.title: The Great Lakes of Africa
projects.subtitle: Two Thousand Years of History
projects.description: Zone Books needed new maps for an English translation of the authoritative history of this region.

projects.title: Art of the First Cities
projects.subtitle: The Third Millenium B.C. from the Mediterranean to the Indus

projects.title: Special Registration Map
projects.description: Illustration to accompany a magazine article about the INS' post-9/11  program of registering immigrants from certain countries.

projects.title: Timeline of Art History
projects.description: The Met's award-winning educational website utilizes many dozens of maps which I created over the course of a couple of years.

projects.title: The Responsive Eye
projects.subtitle: Ralph T. Coe and the Collecting of American Indian Art
projects.description: Map showing broad geographical classification of native peoples in North America.

projects.title: Turning Point
projects.subtitle: Oribe and the Arts of Sixteenth-Century Japan
projects.description: A map showing important kiln sites from Japan's Momoyama period (1573-1615).

projects.title: Hunt for Paradise
projects.subtitle: Court Arts of Iran, 1501-1576
projects.description: A map of Iran during the Safavid period.

projects.title: Shooting Locations Map
projects.description: For a 10-year retrospective exhibition at the Art Directors Club, I was commissioned to produce this wall-size decorative map, showing all of the commercial production company's shooting locations.

projects.title: Beyond Babylon
projects.subtitle: Art, Trade, and Diplomacy in the Second Millennium B.C.
projects.description: I created these maps for an exhibition on the extensive trade interconnections in the Mediterranean world and beyond during the second millennium B.C.

projects.title: Global Islands
projects.subtitle: Une Agora Reunionnaise
projects.description: I worked with artist Caecilia Tripp, during her P.S.1 residency in Queens, to create this map-derived artwork showing the "ultraperiphery" (remote, non-sovereign island territories) of Europe. The map was used as part of an installation at Office Roomade in Brussels.

projects.title: Heritage of Power
projects.subtitle: Ancient Sculpture from West Mexico; The Andrall E. Pearson Family Collection
projects.description: Map of western Mexico

projects.title: All the Mighty World
projects.subtitle: The Photographs of Roger Fenton, 1852-1860
projects.description: Map of United Kingdom showing sites important to Fenton's work.

projects.title: China
projects.subtitle: Dawn of a Golden Age, 200-750 AD

projects.title: Recarving China's Past
projects.subtitle: Archaeology, and Architecture of the "Wu Family Shrines"
projects.description: Map of showing site of "Wu Family Shrines" cemetery and other places of interest in Shandong Province.

projects.title: Adorning the World
projects.subtitle: Art of the Marquesas Islands
projects.description: The Marquesas Islands group in the South Pacific.

projects.title: Loft Movement
projects.description: Brent Edwards, professor of English at Rutgers University, and a cultural historian of jazz, asked me to produce some maps illustrating important locations in the downtown New York jazz scene of the 1970s. This period is sometimes known as the "loft movement."

projects.title: Detainee Map
projects.subtitle: Thousand Points Of Light
projects.description: Digital artist JT Nimoy, Naeem Mohaiemen and I created this map visualization of the geographic distribution of post-9/11 mass detentions in the US. It is part of the Disappeared in America project, and the map was accepted into Futuresonic 2006 in Manchester.

projects.title: Her Noise
projects.description:
This whimsical diagram does more to obfuscate, rather than elucidate, the interrelationships between several generations of female experimental musicians.

It was used as an exhibition catalogue cover for an exhibit at South London Gallery of newly commissioned works by five women sound artists.

projects.title: Tesoros/ Treasures/ Tesouros
projects.subtitle: The Arts in Latin America, 1492-1820
projects.description: Maps to accompany an exhibition of fine and decorative arts in the Americas spanning the era from European conquest to the advent of national independence movements.

projects.title: Hatshepsut
projects.subtitle: From Queen to Pharaoh
projects.description: Maps to accompany an exhibition about Hatshepsut, female pharaoh of Egypt's 18th dynasty, who presided over a time of economic prosperity and artistic innovation.

projects.title: I See No Stranger
projects.subtitle: Early Sikh Art and Devotion
projects.description: Gallery wall maps for an exhibition of early Sikh devotional art.

projects.title: Art of Africa
projects.subtitle: Teachers' Resource Kit
projects.description: Printed map insert to be included in a kit of teaching materials.

projects.title: Urbanathlon
projects.description: Race course map for an urban triathlon in Manhattan sponsored by Men's Health Magazine.

projects.title: MegaStructures: Science of Concrete
projects.description: Raw footage of animated maps for "MegaStructures: Science of Concrete" in National Geographic Channel's MegaStructures series.

projects.title: Cropsey
projects.description:
Raw footage of animated maps for Cropsey, an upcoming "horror documentary" about child abductions—both rumored and real—in New York City.

The action takes place on Staten Island, probably the least well-known of the five boroughs of NYC. The directors therefore wanted to use maps to aid the storytelling.

projects.title: 2006 Midterm Analysis
projects.description: These slides come from a series of visualizations created to help contextualize the major shifts that took place during the November 2006 US midterm elections.

projects.title: Eternal Ancestors
projects.subtitle: The Art of the Central African Reliquary
projects.description: From a series of maps showing the locations of various historical central African cultures, as well as the physical geography of the region.

projects.title: New Galleries for Oceanic Art
projects.description: Maps appearing in a book accompanying new galleries at the Met devoted to Oceanic Art.

projects.title: PlayPumps Locations
projects.description: This Google Maps "mashup" shows selected installations of PlayPumps throughout southern Africa. PlayPumps are sustainable systems for drawing clean water which are powered by childrens' merry-go-rounds. More information at playpumps.org. Live version of the mashup at playpumps.org/maps.

projects.title: Islam in Southeast Asia
projects.description:
The Asia Society commissioned me to create a series of maps for a school curriculum on the history of Islam in Southeast Asia.

We developed political, physical shaded relief, and thematic maps for each of the following regions: Eurasia, southeast Asia, and the Indo-Malay archipelago.

projects.title: Ancient Near East Gallery
projects.description: This map, for a text panel in the Ancient Near East galleries at the Metropolitan, shows the Parthian homeland and empire in the third century BCE.

projects.title: NBA Earth
projects.description:
Wieden+Kennedy worked with me to create a basketball-themed layer for Google Earth as part of ESPN's "Your NBA Destination" advertising campaign.

The layer consists of custom artwork, 3D models, and tons of so-called "placemarks" representing historical trivia, player hometowns, team arenas and as well as a couple of easter eggs.

The KML file can be loaded directly into Google Earth, or you can browse the video and screen captures here.

projects.title: Yale Medicine West Campus
projects.description: I created map illustrations of Yale Medical School's planned West Campus expansion, for use as cover and editorial illustrations in Yale Medicine magazine.

projects.title: A Handbook of the Collection
projects.description: When NAMA published in 2008 the first update to its Handbook in fifteen years, they asked me to create this series of four maps to introduce the various sections. I took the opportunity to employ a technique for creating natural-color maps, in which the map's palette is based on ground cover (grassland, desert, etc) rather than the more common method of using elevation to determine the map's coloration.

projects.title: The Dawn of Egyptian Art
projects.description: Ancient Egypt: Predynastic and Early Dynastic sites

projects.title: Next Door Neighbors
projects.description: WNPT Nashville Public Television is producing a series called Next Door Neighbors, which examines Nashville’s growing role as an immigrant destination. The first two installments were on the Kurdish and Somali communities, and WNPT asked me to produce these HDTV-compatible maps for the episodes.

projects.title: James Castle
projects.description: Map for a retrospective of the work of James Castle (1899–1977), an artist from rural Idaho.

projects.title: Landscapes Clear and Radiant
projects.description: Maps of eastern China for an exhibition of landscape paintings by the late 17th-century artist Wang Hui.

projects.title: PollTrack
projects.description: Art critic and political observer Maurice Berger commissioned me to develop PollTrack, a mapping and blogging platform for his analysis of the landmark 2008 US election cycle. The site, built in Ruby on Rails, features an integrated blogging platform, CMS, and a standards-based map display. Graphic design by Jeanne Ivy.

projects.title: Napa Valley
projects.description: Renowned design shop 2x4 commissioned me to create artwork to be used in the packaging design for a Napa Valley winery.

projects.title: Patron and Painter
projects.description: A series of three maps for an exhibition on the works of 18th century Tibetan painter Situ Panchen.

projects.title: Sources of Vietnamese Tradition
projects.description: A series of maps commissioned by Columbia University Press for a compendium of primary document translations spanning several centuries of Vietnamese history.

projects.title: IFPDA.org
projects.description: I worked with MediaCombo to implement a new website for the International Fine Print Dealers Association, built using the open-source Drupal content management system.

projects.title: Art of the Korean Renaissance
projects.description: A simple map of Korea, included in an exhibition on art from the first 200 years of the Joseon dynasty.

projects.title: Victorious Ones
projects.description: A map of temple and pilgrimmage sites, to accompany an exhibition of images of the Tirthankaras of Jainism.

projects.title: Kantha
projects.description: This map illustrated an exhibition of embroidered quilts from the Jill and Sheldon Bonovitz and the Stella Kramrisch Collections.

projects.title: Colburn's Butte
projects.description: A map to accompany an article by Kevin J. Avery in the Met's scholarly journal.

projects.title: Cochineal Red
projects.description: Maps showing the origin and cultivation of the various cochineal and other red-dye scale insects from which red colorants have been derived.

projects.title: Pompeii
projects.description: A contour map of Pompeii, Mount Vesuvius and environs, created for the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Bulletin.

projects.title: Gateway to Himalayan Art
projects.description: I worked with RBH to produce a large (roughly 15'×7') backlit map installation for Gateway to Himalayan Art, a new exhibition on permanent display on the second floor of the Rubin. This map artwork served as the basis for that installation.

projects.title: The World of Khubilai Khan
projects.description: Maps to illustrate an exhibition on the art of the Yuan Dynasty, founded by Khubilai Khan.

projects.title: Olmec
projects.description: Maps to accompany an exhibition of Olmec objects: colossal heads, thrones, stelae as well as smaller decorative objects.

projects.title: The Nepalese Legacy
projects.description: Maps to illustrate an exhibition tracing the influence of Nepali artists on Tibetan Buddhist art after the decline of Indian Buddhism in the thirteenth century.

projects.title: Italian Medieval Sculpture
projects.description: Map for a volume surveying the Met's entire collection of Italian sculpture from the 9th to the 15th centuries

projects.title: Wisdom Embodied
projects.description: Map for a volume surveying the 120 works from the Met's collections of Indian and Chinese sculpture.

projects.title: ProxyDemocracy
projects.description: I was commissioned by political scientist Andy Eggers to help develop ProxyDemocracy.org, a tool which allows investors to use their proxy voting power—either as shareholders or as mutual fund owners—to hold corporations accountable for their behavior.

projects.title: Poetry in Clay
projects.description: A pair of maps created for an exhibition of strikingly modern-looking ceramic ware from 15th-16th c. Korea. The maps were used in the exhibition design, the catalogue, and for first time ever, in an iPad app accompanying the exhibition.

projects.title: Turkmen Jewelry
projects.description: A map of Central Asia for a book on 19th-20th c. Turkmen silver work. Note the disappearing Aral Sea.

projects.title: Heroic Africans
projects.description: A series of maps for an exhibition of regional sculptural traditions that prevailed throughout precolonial Africa.

projects.title: Wonder of the Age
projects.description: A series of maps for a landmark exhibition and book, which convey recent scholarship allowing for the identification of some 40 individual artists across 800 years of Indian painting.

projects.title: Sultans of the South
projects.description: The distinctive styles in painting and other arts that arose in the sultanates of India's Deccan plateau were the subject of a 2008 symposium and a 2011 publication from the Met. This series of maps appears in that symposium volume.

projects.title: Mirror of the Buddha
projects.description: A map accompanying an exhibition of Tibetan portraits at the Rubin, the third in series on Tibetan art.

projects.title: Storytelling in Japanese Painting
projects.description: A map that appeared in a book presenting 30 Japanese scrolls from the 13th to the 19th c.

projects.title: Fire and Sand
projects.subtitle: Ancient Glass in the Princeton University Art Museum
projects.description: Map of the eastern Mediterannean.

projects.title: The New Islamic Art Wing
projects.subtitle: Art of the Arab Lands, Turkey, Iran, Central Asia, and Later South Asia
projects.description: Created in close collaboration with the Met's department of Islamic Art, this series of maps is part of the newly reimagined permanent exhibition of art from the Islamic world. Each map is tailored to design of the gallery in which it appears.

projects.title: Durer and Beyond
projects.subtitle: Central European Drawings in The Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1400-1700
projects.description: Central Europe

projects.title: Byzantium and Islam
projects.subtitle: Age of Transition
projects.description: Byzantium and Islam 7th–9th c.

projects.title: Peruvian Featherworks
projects.subtitle: Art of the Precolumbian Era
projects.description: Map for an exhibition devoted to the feather arts of ancient Peru.

projects.title: Afghanistan
projects.subtitle: Forging Civilizations along the Silk Road
projects.description: Maps for inclusion in a symposium volume.

projects.title: Gutai
projects.subtitle: Splendid Playground
projects.description: Map of sites and selected prefectures in the Kansai region of Japan for an exhibition of the postwar Gutai collective of modernist artists.

projects.title: Art of German Stoneware
projects.description: Stoneware production centers in northern Europe

projects.title: The Black Hat Eccentric
projects.subtitle: Visions of the Tenth Karmapa
projects.description: Map spread, showing the sequential travels of Tenth Karmapa Chöying Dorje

projects.title: The Place of Provenance
projects.subtitle: Regional Styles in Tibetan Painting
projects.description: Maps for the fourth in a series of exhibitions on Tibetan art.

projects.title: Measure of America
projects.description: Choropleth maps for a UNDP-style human development index (HDI) analysis of locales in the US.

projects.title: Islamic Teacher Resource Kit
projects.description: Adapted from the maps I created for the new Islamic Art wing, these were included in a resource kit for K-12 educators.

projects.title: Beyond Babylon (Symposium)
projects.subtitle: Art, trade, and diplomacy in the second millennium B.C.
projects.description: Included in a publication following a symposium about the 2008 exhibition.

projects.title: The Houses of Louis Kahn
projects.description: I created this map for the first book to look at Louis Kahn's major private residential projects.

projects.title: Creating the Cloisters
projects.description: The Met published a special edition of its Bulletin for the 75th anniversary of The Cloisters, detailing its development in the early 20th century. This map shows the the consolidation of properties and the creation of roads and services that resulted in Fort Tryon Park, in which The Cloisters is situated.

projects.title: Interwoven Globe
projects.subtitle: The Worldwide Textile Trade, 1500–1800
projects.description: Maps for an exhibition and book surveying the burgeoning global trade in textiles from the 16th to the 19th centures.

projects.title: Silla
projects.subtitle: Korea's Golden Kingdom
projects.description: For an exhibition of art from the Korean kingdom of Silla, I created this map showing Korea as a terminus of the Silk Road trade.

projects.title: Tibet and India
projects.subtitle: Buddhist Traditions and Transformations
projects.description: Maps for publication and exhibition showing sites of importance during the spread of Buddhism from north India to Tibet.

projects.title: Lost Kingdoms
projects.subtitle: Hindu-Buddhist Sculpture of Early Southeast Asia
projects.description: Maps for a landmark exhibition of sculpture from the Hindu and Buddhist kingdoms which flourished in Southeast Asia from the 5th to the 9th centuries.

projects.title: Captain Linnaeus Tripe
projects.subtitle: Photographer of India and Burma, 1852–1860
projects.description: Two maps commissioned by the National Gallery of Art for a book and exhibition surveying photographs made by Linnaeus Tripe in British India and Burma in the 1850s.

projects.title: Map/Timeline for Educators
projects.subtitle: metmuseum.org
projects.description: I worked with the Education department at the Met to create this interactive map and timeline resource to aid K-12 educators in finding lesson plans and other resources about artworks in the museum's collection.

projects.title: Embodiments
projects.subtitle: Masterworks of African Figurative Sculpture
projects.description: Map of over 100 cultural groups for an exhibition of sculptures from sub-Saharan Africa.

projects.title: Warriors and Mothers
projects.subtitle: Epic Mbembe Art
projects.description: Locator map of the Mbembe people of southeastern Nigeria, for an exhibition of monumental wooden sculpture.

projects.title: Bartholomeus Spranger
projects.subtitle: Splendor and Eroticism in Imperial Prague
projects.description: Map of Bartholomeus Spranger's travels throughout the Holy Roman Empire, to accompany a survey of his paintings, drawings, and etchings.

projects.title: Buddhist Art of Myanmar
projects.description: Maps to accompany a pioneering exhibition of Buddhist art from Myanmar (formerly known as Burma).

projects.title: Ennion
projects.subtitle: Master of Roman Glass
projects.description: These maps of production centers and find spots of Roman hand-blown glass accompanied an exhibition of the work of Ennion, one of the few ancient glass makers who signed his work.

projects.title: Maps of Mexico
projects.description: Maps of Mexico for scholarly works by Silvia Arrom (Volunteering for a Cause: Gender, Faith, and Charity in Mexico from the Reform to the Revolution) and Randal Sheppard (Left-wing Exile in Mexico, 1934-60), published by the University of New Mexico Press.

projects.title: Becoming Another
projects.subtitle: The Power of Masks
projects.description: Maps to accompany an exhibition highlighting the commonality in mask traditions from Asia, Siberia and the Americas

projects.title: The Arts of Nepal and Tibet
projects.description: Maps for the reinstalled permanent galleries of Nepalese and Tibetan art.

projects.title: The Greatest Grid
projects.subtitle: The Master Plan of Manhattan
projects.description:
In collaboration with MediaCombo and the Museum of the City of New York, I designed and developed two interactive historical maps to for an online exhibition about the origin of the grid plan for Manhattan.

The original 1811 Commissioners' Plan was brought to life with annotations which highlight various aspects of the initial conception of the grid. And the Randel Farm Maps (a 92-volume survey map of Manhattan in the 1810s on the eve of the grid) was composited into a single composite image, from which we indexed and made available every text on the map: landowners, physical features, roads and buildings.

Both maps were georectified, tiled and presented as fully interactive web maps, with the ability to browse, search, zoom and compare against the modern street grid of Manhattan.

projects.title: New York Air
projects.subtitle: The View From Above
projects.description: Abrams commissioned me to devise endpaper maps, which could double as a visual table of contents, for New York Air, the latest book of aerial photography by George Steinmetz.

projects.title: Kongo
projects.subtitle: Power and Majesty
projects.description: Series of maps for Kongo: Power and Majesty, the Met's landmark survey of Central African art from the 15th to the 20th centuries.

projects.title: Vigée Le Brun
projects.subtitle: Woman Artist in Revolutionary France
projects.description: A map showing the travels of Elisabeth Louise Vigée Le Brun, for Vigée Le Brun: Woman Artist in Revolutionary France, her first retrospective exhibition.

projects.title: Divine Pleasures
projects.subtitle: Painting from India's Rajput Courts
projects.description: Map of south Asia for Divine Pleasures: Painting from India's Rajput Courts—The Kronos Collections.

projects.title: The Art of Guido Cagnacci
projects.description: Map of the historical region of Romagna for an exhibition and book on Guido Cagnacci.

projects.title: The Mary Griggs Burke Collection
projects.description:
Over five decades Mary Griggs Burke assembled one of the finest private collections of Asian art, including the largest collection of Japanese art outside of Japan.

The Burke Foundation produced a two-volume catalogue of the entire collection before it was to be gifted to various institutions, including the Metropolitan Museum and the Minneapolis Institute of Art.

I was asked to create a website that would serve as an online counterpart to the catalogue, and would make use of the web to provide features not available in the printed book, such as multi-faceted browsing and searching capabilities, high-resolution image details, and interactive bibliographies.

projects.title: Art of Impermanence
projects.subtitle: Japanese Works from the John C. Weber Collection and Mr. and Mrs. John D. Rockefeller 3rd Collection
projects.description: Map to accompany an exhibition at the Asia Society about transience and impermanence in Japanese art.

projects.title: Dia
projects.subtitle: An Introduction to Dia's Locations and Sites
projects.description: This map of Dia's worldwide sites and installations was used as the front and back endpapers for Dia: An Introduction to Dia’s Locations and Sites.

projects.title: The Charterhouse of Bruges
projects.subtitle: Jan van Eyck, Petrus Christus, and Jan Vos
projects.description: Map for a book and exhibition at the Frick, featuring masterworks from fifteenth-century Bruges.

projects.title: Códice Maya de México
projects.subtitle: Understanding the Oldest Surviving Book of the Americas
projects.description: A map accompanying a book and exhibition dedicated to the oldest surviving book from the Americas, a roughly 12th century Mayan almanac that tracked the movements of Venus.

projects.title: Storied Stone
projects.subtitle: Reframing the Philadelphia Museum of Art's South Indian Temple Hall
projects.description: Maps to accompany a book about the history of the temple installation inside the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

projects.title: The Colmar Treasure
projects.subtitle: A Medieval Jewish Legacy
projects.description: A map to accompany a book and an exhibition at the Met Cloisters about a cache of precious objects hidden by the Jewish community of Colmar, France during the Black Death pogroms of the 14th century.

projects.title: Islamic Art Wing
projects.description: A decade after creating the original maps for the new Islamic Art wing, I was asked to update the world map that sits at the entrance.

projects.title: Bestowing Beauty
projects.subtitle: Masterpieces from Persian Lands
projects.description: Maps to accompany an book and exhibition of a private collection of Persian art

projects.title: Diamond Mountains
projects.subtitle: Travel and Nostalgia in Korean Art
projects.description: Maps to accompany an book and exhibition of pictorial representations of Mount Geumgang in present-day North Korea, also known as the Diamond Mountains.

projects.title: The Eternal Feast
projects.subtitle: Banqueting in Chinese Art from the 10th to the 14th Century
projects.description: Maps to accompany an book and exhibition about images of feasting in Chinese art from the Song, Liao, and Yuan dynasties.

slides.caption: Map showing the relationship between the Holy Roman Empire and the lands of the Bohemian Crown under Charles IV around the turn of the fifteenth century.

The illustration had to be sized so as to span eight pages of the magazine at high resolution. The resulting composite file was immense - approx 2GB. But it did allow for detailed usage in the layout, as shown on the opening spread here. (Art direction by Jason Lancaster)

Latino vote by party, 1996–2006 — The Latino vote had been tilting towards the Republican party for several election cycles, a trend which sharply reversed in 2006, most likely due to the Republican-led attack on immigrants (HR 4437 etc.) which took place earlier in the year.
Latinos remain more antiwar than general population

The focus of IFPDA.org is on the member dealers who make up the association. Each member has a dedicated page detailing collecting areas, upcoming exhibitions and currently available works.
The site also is home to a database of 2000+ artists, each one of whom gets page showing which member dealers are currently offering their works.
IFPDA offers a comprehensive international calendar relating to the world of prints: exhibitions, art fairs and other special events.
